title: Chef John's American Goulash Recipe
description: This American goulash is a one-pot, cafeteria-style mix of ground beef, macaroni, and a seasoned tomato sauce. It's the comfort food of your childhood!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Stews Goulash Recipes Chef John's American Goulash 4.8 (431) 356 Reviews 71 Photos American goulash was one of my all-time favorite comfort food meals when I was growing up. They served it in my school cafeteria alongside a slice of buttered white bread and a carton of milk. This Americanized version of goulash was invented to stretch a small amount of beef into enough food for a not-so-small family. It's a simple dish that doesn't taste simple, so it's perfect for your weeknight dinner rotation. By John Mitzewich John Mitzewich John Mitzewich — aka Chef John — has produced more than 1,500 cooking videos for Allrecipes. He's the actor, director, and screenwriter whose hands and voice confidently walk you through techniques. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 tablespoon olive oil 2 pounds ground beef 1 large onion, diced 4 cloves garlic, minced 2 large bay leaves 2 tablespoons Hungarian paprika 2 teaspoons Italian seasoning 2 teaspoons kosher salt ½ teaspoon ground black pepper 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste 1 quart chicken broth or water 1 (24 ounce) jar marinara sauce 1 (15 ounce) can diced tomatoes 1 cup water 2 tablespoons soy sauce 2 cups elbow macaroni ¼ cup chopped Italian parsley 1 cup shredded white Cheddar cheese (Optional) Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat oil in a pot over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and onion; cook and stir until beef is browned and crumbly and onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Continue to cook and stir until liquid is evaporated, 3 to 5 minutes. Add garlic, bay leaves, paprika, Italian seasoning, salt, black pepper, and cayenne. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook, stirring occasionally, until flavors come together, about 3 minutes. Pour in broth, marinara sauce, and diced tomatoes. Pour water into the sauce jar, swirl, and pour into the pot. Stir in soy sauce; bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer until flavors intensify, about 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Increase the heat to medium-high and bring to a rapid simmer. Stir in macaroni; cook, stirring occasionally, until just barely tender, about 12 minutes. Check for doneness after 10 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Remove from the heat and discard bay leaves. Stir in Cheddar and parsley. Cover and let rest for 5 minutes. Taste and season as desired. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Chef's Notes Make your own Italian herb mix with a blend of oregano, thyme, rosemary, sage, parsley, and basil.You can use sweet Spanish paprika if you can't find Hungarian paprika. You can also add beans to turn this into an excellent pasta fazool. Add Your Photo Photos of Chef John's American Goulash 01 of 71 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 71 Photo by  Lori S 03/17/2025 A keeper! Chef John has never steered me wrong yet! Followed recipe to the letter, except I used smoked paprika & both Worcestershire & soy sauce. 03 of 71 Photo by  TraciAnn And BB 03/03/2025 This recipe was very good. Brings back memories of my mom! She used to make it for us exactly like this recipe! Thanks Chef for reminding me how good of a cook my mom was by posting this recipe! 04 of 71 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02/12/2025 Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser Great taste and big enough portions to feed a family of 4 and have some portions for the following days. Did a low-sodium option & added more macaroni. Overall, made the following substitutions:0.5 quart beef broth + 0.5 water, instead of 1 quart beef broth.No-sodium-added marinara sauce.3 cups macaroni instead of 2.1 red bell pepper.Chili flakes instead of cayenne/paprika. 05 of 71 Photo by  DREGINEK 02/03/2025 I am a huge Chef John fan but this was just meh-good. It IS good but no better or worse than the varied versions of goulash I have had at 100 potlucks over the years. I only made two changes; I reduced ground beef to 1lb vs 2 and skipped the step of rinsing the marinara jar with water and adding it to the pot. Towards the end, I was worried that I had too much liquid to my pasta/beef but after I let sit, it thickened nicely - especially with the cheese. Again, we did like this! But I didn’t think it was anything super special and usually coming from Chef John - it nearly almost is. Still glad we tried!! Thank you! 06 of 71 Photo by  candy Lozano 01/05/2025 Crowd-pleaser Family favorite A keeper! Not only is it exactly what I was looking for when trying to recreate a meal from my early childhood. It was a perfect flavor match. When I served it to my husband and kids everyone Raved about how much they enjoyed the meal. I will without a doubt be making this regularly from now on.- I used 3 1/2 cups Large elbow noodles instead of 2 c. Regular elbow noodles.- I used mild Cheddar and served with Parmesan sprinkled on top.-No fresh parsley garnish.* I keep trying to load a picture but it never loads.. (mobile) 07 of 71 Photo by  Donna Gluecklich-Sullivan 08/05/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow I had such a taste for Goulash and came across this recipe. I followed as is, except I had 2 small jalapenos from my garden I needed to use, so I chopped them up and added them to the meat/onion mixture. This is a keeper for sure! Thank you Chef John! Your recipes never disappoint! 08 of 71 Photo by  EdgyAcai8114 02/02/2024 Worth the effort Although it has a lot of salt I think if you omit the soy sauce you can rectify that but I made it as written. Definitely yummy. 09 of 71 Photo by  54321kath 01/13/2024 Wonderful recipe! Made half the amount which was still a pot full. Used a half jar of sauce from my freezer from another meal and added a can of corn at the end - family preference. Great food for this snow storm day as I had all ingredients on hand. Looking forward to leftovers. 10 of 71 Photo by  Tammy's Recipes 01/07/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Loved it! I did not have bay leaf so I omitted that. Made the Italian seasoning with Oregano, basil, parsley, and sage 1/2 teaspoon each, added 1/2 teaspoon of pepper flakes.
